name: TCP_SCAN
description: A reconnaissance scan using the TCP protocol is often an indicator of a malicious attacker searching for a device vulnerable to a network attack, such as MITM.

name: UDP_SCAN
description: A reconnaissance scan using the UDP protocol is often an indicator of a malicious attacker searching for a device vulnerable to a network attack, such as MITM.

name: IP_SCAN
description: A reconnaissance scan using the IP protocol is often an indicator of a malicious attacker searching for a device vulnerable to a network attack, such as MITM.

name: ARP_SCAN
description: A reconnaissance scan using the ARP protocol is often an indicator of a malicious attacker searching for a device vulnerable to a network attack, such as MITM.

name: ARP_MITM
description: A man-in-the-middle attack using ARP table poisoning is when a malicious attacker can hijack traffic, steal credentials, and deliver malware to the device.

name: MALICIOUS_WEBSITE
description: A potentially malicious website address (URL) link was tapped on the device.

name: ABNORMAL_PROCESS_ACTIVITY
description: Detected abnormal activity. Your device is being monitored for any attacks.

name: ICMP_REDIR_MITM
description: A man-in-the-middle attack using ICMP protocol is when a malicious attacker can hijack traffic, steal credentials, and deliver malware to the device.

name: RUNNING_AS_ROOT
description: A malicious process that results in the elevation of privileges on the mobile device allows an attacker to take full control of the device.

name: APK_SUSPECTED
description: A known malicious app attempts to control the device in some manner, such as elevation of privileges or spyware.

name: SSL_STRIP
description: A man-in-the-middle attack using SSL stripping allows a malicious attacker to change HTTPS traffic to HTTP, so they can hijack traffic, steal credentials, and deliver malware to the device.

name: PROXY_CHANGE
description: Proxy configuration changes on the mobile device can be indicative of sending traffic to a non-intended destination.

name: GATEWAY_CHANGE
description: Gateway configuration changes on the mobile device can be indicative of sending traffic to a non-intended destination.

name: DNS_CHANGE
description: The DNS configuration changed on the mobile device. If the DNS change happened within your own network to an unknown DNS server, then it is likely a MITM attempt.

name: FILES_SYSTEM_CHANGED
description: A normal file system change occurred.

name: UNTRUSTED_PROFILE
description: An untrusted profile is a profile installed on one or more devices and is unsafe on your devices. An untrusted profile installed on devices can be used to control devices remotely, monitor and manipulate user activities, and hijack users' traffic.

name: UNKNOWN_SOURCES_ON
description: App downloads from locations other than the Google Play store are enabled.

name: SSL_MITM
description: A man-in-the-middle attack using a fake certificate occurred, and this is when a malicious attacker can hijack traffic, steal credentials, and deliver malware to the device.

name: NETWORK_HANDOFF
description: A network handoff occurred and can allow a device to alter routing on a network, potentially allowing for a man-in-the-middle attack.

name: SYSTEM_TAMPERING
description: System tampering is a process of removing security limitations that are in place by the device manufacturer, and it indicates that the device is fully compromised and can no longer be trusted.

name: ROGUE_ACCESS_POINT
description: Rogue access points exploit a device vulnerability to connect to a previously known Wi-Fi network by masking preferred and known networks.

name: DEVICE_ROOTED
description: Jailbreaking and rooting are the processes of gaining unauthorized access or elevated privileges on a system. Jailbreaking and rooting can potentially open security holes that may not have been apparent or undermine the device's built-in security measures.

name: STAGEFRIGHT_VULNERABLE
description: Stagefright vulnerability indicates the device is on an OS patch version susceptible to compromise.

name: SUSPICIOUS_IPA
description: A known malicious app is detected and can attempt to take control of the device in some manner, such as elevation of privileges or spyware.

name: DAEMON_ANOMALY
description: A daemon anomaly indicates abnormal system process activities that can indicate that the device has been exploited.

name: USB_DEBUGGING_ON
description: USB debugging is an advanced configuration option intended for development purposes only. By enabling USB debugging, your device can accept commands from a computer when plugged into a USB connection.

name: SUSPICIOUS_PROFILE
description: A suspicious profile is a new profile introduced into the environment and is not explicitly trusted or untrusted. An administrator must review the profile and mark the profile as trusted or untrusted.

name: DEVELOPER_OPTIONS_ON
description: Developer Options is an advanced configuration option intended for development purposes only. When enabled, the user has the option to change advanced settings, compromising the integrity of the device settings.

name: INTERNAL_NETWORK_ACCESS
description: An app was detected connecting to private or internal servers. It is uncommon for public applications to connect to internal servers. Public applications connecting to internal servers is considered suspicious behavior and needs investigation immediately for the possible threat of malware installed on the device and the risk of data leakage.

name: ENCRYPTION_NOT_ENABLED
description: Encryption is not set up on the device and is needed to protect the device's content.

name: PASSCODE_NOT_ENABLED
description: The device is not set up to use a PIN code or password to control access to the device.

name: ANDROID_NOT_UPDATED
description: The Android version installed on the device is not up to date. The outdated operating system exposes the device to known vulnerabilities and the threat of being exploited by malicious actors. You need to update the operating system immediately.

name: IOS_NOT_UPDATED
description: The iOS version installed on the device is not up to date. The outdated operating system exposes the device to known vulnerabilities and the threat of being exploited by malicious actors. You need to update the operating system immediately.

name: SELINUX_DISABLED
description: Security-enhanced Linux (SELinux) is a security feature in the operating system that helps maintain the operating system's integrity. If SELinux has been disabled, the operating system's integrity may be compromised and should be investigated immediately.

name: ROGUE_ACCESS_POINT_NEARBY
description: Rogue access points exploit device vulnerability to connect to a previously known Wi-Fi network by masking preferred and known networks.

name: UNSECURED_WIFI_NETWORK
description: A connection to an unsecured Wi-Fi network is detected, and these networks are not protected by encryption or authentication protocols and are open to attackers.

name: CAPTIVE_PORTAL
description: Captive portal networks route traffic through a single proxy (portal), potentially opening up the traffic to monitoring.

name: TRACEROUTE_MITM
description: A man-in-the-middle attack occurred where a malicious attacker can hijack traffic, steal credentials, and deliver malware to the device.

name: BLUEBORNE_VULNERABLE
description: The device is vulnerable to a BlueBorne attack, which leverages Bluetooth connections to penetrate and take control of targeted devices. To avoid any risk from BlueBorne, the user needs to permanently turn off Bluetooth until an update is available from your device manufacturer or wireless carrier. For those users that still require the use of Bluetooth, it is recommended that Bluetooth is turned off until it is needed and only in a trusted and secure area.

name: ANDROID_COMPATIBILITY_TESTING
description: The profile of the Android device does not match the profile of any devices that have passed Google's Android compatibility testing.

name: ANDROID_BASIC_INTEGRITY
description: Possible tampering may have occurred with the Android device.

name: MALICIOUS_WEBSITE_OPENED
description: A user tapped a potentially malicious URL on the device. The user was warned of potential danger with the linked site, and chose to continue to the website after the warning.

name: APP_TAMPERING
description: Existing app libraries may have been modified, or a foreign library may have been injected into the app.

name: SIDELOADED_APP
description: Sideloaded apps are installed independently of an official app store and can present a security risk.

name: TLS_DOWNGRADE
description: SSL/TLS downgrades force apps to use old encryption protocols. These protocols may be vulnerable to attacks that allow third parties to view encrypted information.

name: ZIPS_NOT_RUNNING_ON_CONTAINER
description: The Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) application is not activated on both the personal and work profiles on this device. Install and activate the MTD app in both locations to ensure full device protection.

name: DANGERZONE_CONNECTED
description: The device connected to a Wi-Fi network where malicious attacks have been observed.

name: DANGERZONE_NEARBY
description: The device is near a Wi-Fi network where malicious attacks have been observed.

name: GOOGLE_PLAY_PROTECT_DISABLED
description: Google Play Protect has been disabled on this device. Google Play Protect helps protect the device from malicious apps and needs to be re-enabled.

name: ANDROID_DEBUG_BRIDGE_APPS_NOT_VERIFIED
description: Apps installed via ADB are not required to be verified. This may allow malicious apps to be installed on the device.

name: OVER_THE_AIR_UPDATES_DISABLED
description: Over-the-air (OTA) updates have been disabled on this device. OTA updates help keep a device's software up to date and more secure.

name: ALWAYS_ON_VPN_APP_SET
description: An app has been configured as an always-on VPN on this device. The app may monitor all device communications with the Internet.

name: VULNERABLE_NON_UPGRADEABLE_IOS_VERSION
description: The device is running a vulnerable iOS version. However, the device is not eligible for an operating system upgrade at this time.

name: VULNERABLE_NON_UPGRADEABLE_ANDROID_VERSION
description: The device is running a vulnerable Android version. However, the device is not eligible for an operating system upgrade at this time.

name: OUT_OF_COMPLIANCE_APP
description: One or more apps are found on the device that are marked as Out-of-Compliance apps.

name: INACTIVE_APP
description: A certain amount of time has passed and the app has not communicated with the server.

name: DEBUG_ENABLED_APK
description: An app with debug enabled is detected and can pose a risk and allow an attacker to control and manipulate the underlying app functions.

name: DEVICE_COMPROMISED_VIA_NETWORK_BASED_ATTACKS
description: The device was compromised by a sophisticated kill chain attack that started at the network and ended leaving the device compromised.

name: DEVICE_COMPROMISED_VIA_MALICIOUS_APP
description: The device was compromised by a sophisticated kill chain attack that started with a malicious app and ended leaving the device compromised.

name: DEVICE_COMPROMISED_VIA_PHISHING_ATTACK
description: The device was compromised by a sophisticated kill chain attack that started with a phishing threat and ended leaving the device compromised.

name: DEVICE_COMPROMISED_VIA_IOS_MALICIOUS_PROFILE
description: The device was compromised by a sophisticated kill chain attack that started with a malicious iOS profile and ended leaving the device compromised.

name: COMPROMISED_NETWORK
description: A pattern of threats occurred that indicates the device is connected to a compromised network. Sensitive data on the device may be intercepted and could be monitored and modified by an unauthorized party.

name: PEGASUS
description: The Pegasus spyware has been detected on the device. Pegasus is a surveillance tool that is used to monitor and collect information from the device.

name: WEBSITE_TAPPED
description: Website content not approved by your organization was tapped on the device.

name: WEBSITE_VISITED
description: A user tapped on website content not approved by your organization. The user was warned the website content does not comply with your organization's policies and chose to continue to the website after the warning.

name: WEBSITE_BLOCKED
description: A user tapped on website content not approved by your organization and the site was blocked.

name: MAL_WEBSITE_TAPPED
description: A potentially malicious website address (URL) link was tapped on the device.

name: MAL_WEBSITE_VISITED
description: A user tapped a potentially malicious link on the device. The user was warned of potential danger with the linked site, and chose to continue to the website after the warning.

name: MAL_WEBSITE_BLOCKED
description: A potentially malicious website address (URL) link was blocked on the device.

name: DEVICE_PENDING_ACTIVATION
description: App activation for the Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) application is not complete.

name: SUSPICIOUS_BROWSER_EXTENSION
description: An unsafe extension is detected. It is strongly recommended that you remove the extension immediately.

name: OOC_BROWSER_EXTENSION
description: A Chrome extension is detected that is marked out of compliance with your organization's policies. It is recommended that you remove it from your Chrome browser.

name: HIGH_RISK_BROWSER_EXTENSION
description: A Chrome extension is detected that has one or more privacy and/or security concerns that may put your personal and confidential information at risk.

name: SIDELOADED_BROWSER_EXTENSION
description: A sideloaded extension is detected, which was not installed from an official web store. These extensions and their developers may not be verified and can present a security risk.

name: DETECTION_PENDING_ACTIVATION
description: Mobile threat detection is pending activation.

name: DETECTION_INACTIVE
description: Mobile threat detection is inactive.
